thread.title: Real Madrid will rival Chelsea and Manchester United for Monaco aces Bernardo Silva and Kylian Mbappe
thread.title_full: Real Madrid will rival Chelsea and Manchester United for Monaco aces Bernardo Silva and Kylian Mbappe

author: gboulton
title: Real Madrid will rival Chelsea and Manchester United for Monaco aces Bernardo Silva and Kylian Mbappe
text:
Bernabeu bound Real Madrid will rival Chelsea and Manchester United for Monaco aces Bernardo Silva and Kylian Mbappe 
Zinedine Zidane is interested in the duo who have been key players for the Ligue 1 leaders this season Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments REAL MADRID are looking to see off Premier League giants Manchester United and Chelsea in their pursuit of Monaco duo Bernado Silva and Kylian Mbappe. 
Zinedine Zidane will set out to sign the pair this summer after they have attracted a lot attention this season after impressing in Ligue 1 and the Champions League. AP:Associated Press 5 Zinedine Zidane is targeting Monaco pair Bernado Silva and Kylian Mbappe 
According to MARCA , Los Blancos have joined both United and the Blues in the race for Silva and Mbappe , who have turned heads in France this season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Real Madrid news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
The two attack-minded players have been key players this campaign and have helped fire Monaco to the top of the league, ahead of title favourites Paris Saint-Germain. 
Attacking midfielder Silva has been a consistent performer for manager Leonardo Jardim this season, scoring eight goals and providing five assists. 
Whilst Zidane ‘s other top target, Mbappe, has been compared to Arsenal legend Thierry Henry. Getty Images Kylian Mbappe’s rise to stardom has been compared to Thierry Henry’s Reuters Henry similarly shone for Monaco after breaking into the first in 1994 Related stories REAL TEST Real Madrid to 'tempt Manchester United into selling David de Gea by offering Raphael Varane in shock swap deal' MALC MY MAN Inter Milan to swoop for Liverpool and Manchester United target Malcom Silva dubbed 'new Neymar' Get Beller-in Pep Guardiola ready to go to war with Barcelona in the summer to sign Arsenal full-back Hector Bellerin Dani's my Boy Juventus defender Dani Alves could be an option for Manchester City this summer if he lowers wage demands Toffees want Roo Everton's audacious bid to bring Wayne Rooney back to Goodison Park turned down by Man Utd Mbappe battle Juventus to rival Arsenal and Man City for Kylian Mbappe after dazzling Champions League display Atleti's Griez plea Atletico Madrid want Antoine Griezmann to snub £85million Manchester United move for another year Willy or won't he? Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being club's No1 keeper 
Despite his age, the 18-year-old striker has been thrown straight into first team action by Jardim and has featured 24 times, scoring 11 goals. 
The forward has thrived in France alongside striking partner Radamel Falcao who has revived his career at the Stade Louis II. 
The most recent player to arrive at the Bernabeu from Monaco was James Rodriguez, who signed for a staggering £63million after proving his class at the 2014 World Cup. Getty Images James Rodriguez was the last player to sign for Real Madrid from Monaco Monaco ace and Manchester United target Bernardo Silva profiled in 60 seconds Topics
